item.title: Julie add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "He died not for men, but for each man. If each man had been the only man made, He would have done no less." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Julie add a quote by John Henry Newman
item.description: "I sought to hear the voice of God and climbed the topmost steeple, but God declared: "Go down again - I dwell among the people." -- John Henry Newman

item.title: Julie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I think God, in creating man, somewhat overestimated his ability." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Julie add a quote by Erma Bombeck
item.description: "When I stand before God at the end of my life, I would hope that I would not have a single bit of talent left, and could say, 'I used everything you gave me." -- Erma Bombeck

item.title: Julie add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Julie add a quote by Paul Terry
item.description: "Whenever I feel the need to exercise, I lie down until it goes away." -- Paul Terry

item.title: Julie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "All women become like their mothers. That is their tragedy. No man does, and that is his." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Julie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The good ended happily, and the bad unhappily. That is what Fiction means." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Julie add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "It would be mortifying to the feelings of many ladies, could they be made to understand how little the heart of a man is affected by what is costly or new in their attire... Woman is fine for her own satisfaction alone. No man will admire her the more, no woman will like her the better for it. Neatness and fashion are enough for the former, and a something of shabbiness or impropriety will be most endearing to the latter." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Julie add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Love looks not with the eyes, but with the mind, And therefore is winged Cupid painted blind." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Julie add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Brevity is the soul of wit." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Julie add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "My words fly up, my thoughts remain below: Words without thoughts never to heaven go." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Julie add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "If a man is called to be a street sweeper, he should sweep streets even as a Michaelangelo painted, or Beethoven composed music or Shakespeare wrote poetry. He should sweep streets so well that all the hosts of heaven and earth will pause to say, 'Here lived a great street sweeper who did his job well." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Julie add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "All that I am or ever hope to be, I owe to my angel mother." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Julie add a quote by Shirley Jackson
item.description: "No live organism can continue for long to exist sanely under conditions of absolute reality." -- Shirley Jackson

item.title: Julie add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Julie add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Julie add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Julie add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Julie add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Julie add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Julie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I can resist anything except temptation." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Julie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Never love anyone who treats you like you're ordinary." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Julie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The suspense is terrible. I hope it will last." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Julie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "A man's face is his autobiography. A woman's face is her work of fiction." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Julie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I was working on the proof of one of my poems all the morning, and took out a comma. In the afternoon I put it back again." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Julie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Where there is sorrow, there is holy ground." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Julie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The most terrible thing about it is not that it breaks one’s heart—hearts are made to be broken—but that it turns one’s heart to stone." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Julie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The reason we all like to think so well of others is that we are all afraid for ourselves. The basis of optimism is sheer terror." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Julie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "People who count their chickens before they are hatched act very wisely because chickens run about so absurdly that it's impossible to count them accurately." -- Oscar Wilde
